intro: Urvillea berteroana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of soft, velvety hairs. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red and bloom in clusters. Urvillea berteroana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
